summary: This is an email chain from March 10, 2021, where a U.S. official is asked by a Canadian counterpart to share a prior briefing on protecting victim identities in the Epstein/Maxwell case. The request is to support Canada's Justice Department in seeking a publication ban for an extradition case, aiming to prevent defense counsel from identifying victims.

persons.name: GM Jetter
persons.context: Named in the filename of an attached document, which is a letter to Judge Nathan regarding victim names and prison privileges in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of a letter from GM Jetter concerning victim identification and prison privileges, as indicated in the attached document's filename.

events.title: Jetter Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: GM Jetter sends a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the protection of victim names and prison privileges in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Request for Victim Protection Briefing
events.description: A U.S. official is contacted by a Canadian counterpart requesting a briefing on procedures to protect victim identities, to support a publication ban in a Canadian extradition case related to Epstein/Maxwell.

keyFacts: The Canadian Justice Department is seeking a 'publication ban' in an extradition case to prevent defense counsel from identifying victims, mirroring concerns in the U.S. Epstein/Maxwell proceedings.
U.S. officials previously prepared a briefing on not identifying victims early in the Epstein/Maxwell case, which is now being requested for international legal coordination.
An attached document from August 13, 2020, indicates prior U.S. legal actions regarding victim name protection and prison privileges, addressed to Judge Nathan.
